articles.author: Andrew Mills, Nidal Al-Mughrabi, Maayan Lubell
articles.description: Israel intensified strikes on Gaza hours after a ceasefire and hostage release deal was announced, residents and authorities in the Palestinian enclave said, and mediators sought to quell fighting ahead of the truce's start on Sunday.
articles.title: Israel, Hamas ceasefire accord followed by airstrikes on Gaza, residents say

articles.author: Timour Azhari
articles.description: Iraq is trying to convince powerful armed factions in the country that have fought U.S. forces and fired rockets and drones at Israel to lay down their weapons or join official security forces, Foreign Minister Fuad Hussein said.
articles.title: Iraq wants Iran-backed factions to lay down weapons, foreign minister says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: A last-minute glitch surfaced on Thursday in the details of the Gaza ceasefire-for-hostages deal and U.S. envoys are working to resolve it, a U.S. official said.
articles.title: US envoys working to resolve last-minute dispute over Gaza deal, US official says

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: South Korea's anti-corruption agency will resume questioning impeached President Yoon Suk Yeol at 2 p.m. (0500 GMT) on Thursday afternoon, the Yonhap news agency reported.
articles.title: South Korea's anti-corruption agency to resume questioning Yoon on Thursday afternoon, Yonhap reports

articles.author: Chad Terhune, Rollo Ross
articles.description: Los Angeles officials told most evacuees from the wildfires on Thursday to stay away from their homes at least another week as emergency responders remove toxic waste from incinerated neighborhoods and cut off electricity and gas lines posing a hazard amid the ruins.
articles.title: Los Angeles evacuees told stay away from home at least another week

articles.author: Makini Brice, Elizabeth Pineau, Dominique Vidalon
articles.description: French Prime Minister Francois Bayrou passed the first test of his new minority government on Thursday as he survived a vote of no-confidence called by the hard left after the centre-left Socialist Party did not back the motion.
articles.title: French PM Bayrou survives no-confidence vote

articles.author: Reuters
articles.description: Three Austrian lawmakers from the far-right Freedom Party won a defamation case against newspaper Der Standard on Thursday over an article that said they attended a funeral where a Nazi song was sung, when in fact it could not be determined if it was.
articles.title: Austrian far-right lawmakers win defamation case against newspaper over hymn

articles.author: Kristina Cooke, Ted Hesson
articles.description: Blanca Figueroa and Severiano Martinez have known from the start of their eight-year marriage that she was at risk of deportation because she entered the United States illegally.
articles.title: The migrants on the frontline of Trump’s mass deportation plan

articles.author: David Lewis, Daphne Psaledakis
articles.description: The United States on Thursday imposed sanctions on Sudan's leader, army chief Abdel Fattah al-Burhan, accusing him of choosing war over negotiations to bring an end to the conflict that has killed tens of thousands of people and driven millions from their homes.
articles.title: US issues sanctions on Sudanese army chief Burhan

articles.author: John Irish
articles.description: The U.S. Department of Justice vigorously opposed at a French court hearing in December the release of a Lebanese militant jailed for attacks on American and Israeli diplomats in France more than 40 years ago, according to a letter seen by Reuters.
articles.title: U.S. pushed to keep Lebanese militant in French prison after 40 years, letter shows
